title: A federal judge blocks Biden’s vaccine mandate for U.S. health workers.
content: The ruling is a setback for the administration’s effort to require vaccination for hospital and nursing home workers, which had been set to start next week.

more_info.byline: By Azi Paybarah and Reed Abelson

title: How 2 Flights to Europe May Have Spurred Spread of New Variant
content: A confounding array of Covid rules and lax enforcement of mask wearing may have sent on infected passengers on two KLM flights from South Africa to “who knows where.”

title: Omicron: What Is Known — and Still Unknown
content: Intense research into the new coronavirus variant first identified in southern Africa has just begun. World leaders have urged people not to panic — and to get vaccinated, if they can.

title: CNN Suspends Chris Cuomo After New Details on Help He Gave His Brother
content: The cable news network’s top-rated anchor was an enthusiastic adviser to Andrew Cuomo in the last 18 months of his governorship.

more_info.byline: By Michael M. Grynbaum and John Koblin

title: The Police Killings Were Years Ago. New Prosecutors Are Reopening Cases.
content: District attorneys around the country are investigating officers in cases their predecessors had handled, raising the ire of police unions that say it undermines public safety.

more_info.byline: By Steve Eder and David D. Kirkpatrick

title: Watching inflation like a hawk, the Fed might start to cut its economic aid.
content: Jerome H. Powell said the Federal Reserve could end its bond-buying program sooner as inflation persists.

more_info.byline: By Jeanna Smialek and Alan Rappeport

title: Meadows Agrees to Cooperate in Capitol Attack Investigation
content: Donald J. Trump’s former chief of staff, Mark Meadows, has turned over documents and agreed to be deposed in the House’s inquiry into the Jan. 6 attack.

title: Dr. Oz Says He’s Running for Senate in Pennsylvania
content: Dr. Mehmet Oz, who is running as a Republican for an open Senate seat, described his frustration with the “arrogant, closed-minded people in charge” who shut schools and businesses during the pandemic.

title: The 10 Best Books of 2021
content: Editors at The Times Book Review choose the best fiction and nonfiction titles this year.

title: Alice Sebold Apologizes to Man Wrongly Convicted of Raping Her
content: Anthony Broadwater spent 16 years in prison after the author identified him as her attacker in an assault she described in her memoir “Lucky.”

more_info.byline: By Alexandra Alter and Karen Zraick

title: Horse Troughs, Hot Tubs and Hashtags: Baptism Is Getting Wild
content: In some evangelical churches, a once-staid ritual is returning to its informal roots — and things sometimes get “a little rowdy” along the way.

title: Jill Biden’s White House Christmas Looks Very … Normal
content: You won’t find any blood-red trees this year.

title: The Teenagers Getting Six Figures to Leave Their High Schools for Basketball
content: The new pro league Overtime Elite is luring young phenoms with hefty salaries, viral success and — perhaps — a better path to the N.B.A.

title: The Guccis Are Really Not Happy About ‘House of Gucci’
content: When artistic license collides with reality, which one wins?

title: I Was Raped by My Father. An Abortion Saved My Life.
content: Anti-abortion laws in Mississippi and Texas contain no exceptions for rape or incest. Here is what that means for survivors.

title: What ‘My Body, My Choice’ Means to the Right
content: On the cusp of overturning Roe, conservatives adopt a pro-choice slogan.

title: The Case Against Abortion
content: Making the argument that lies behind the constitutional debate.

title: On the Trans-Atlantic Price Gap
content: What does (somewhat) lower inflation in Europe tell us about America?

title: Stephen Sondheim Wrote My Life’s Soundtrack
content: “A Little Night Music” was all it took.

title: The Most Powerful Data Broker in the World Is Winning the War Against the U.S.
content: Beijing is  outmaneuvering the United States and its allies in at least one crucial domain: data.

title: Emily Ratajkowski Isn’t Quite Ready to Quit Profiting Off the Male Gaze
content: The model on wielding beauty and power in the age of Instagram.

title: I Once Urged the Supreme Court to Overturn Roe. I’ve Changed My Mind.
content: To overturn Roe now would be an act of constitutional vandalism — not conservative, but reactionary.

title: ‘Her Heart Was Beating Too’: The Women Who Died After Abortion Bans
content: It should not take a high-profile death to expose just how much is at risk when medicine is hamstrung by politics, religion or culture.

title: Becoming a Parent, or Deciding Not To
content: Betty Rollin and other readers discuss whether it is “still OK to procreate.” Also: Following the kids’ lead on masks; regulating cyberwar.

title: Fear and Uncertainty Over the Omicron Variant
content: Readers discuss travel bans, globalism and “variants of kindness.”

title: Kyle Rittenhouse, Travis McMichael and the Problem of ‘Self Defense’
content: More guns, no matter in whose hands, will create more standoffs, more intimidation, more death sanctioned in the eyes of the law.

title: Omicron Is Coming. The U.S. Must Act Now.
content: South Africa gave the world an early warning. Decisive action on containment and surveillance could help us control it.

title: If You Think You Can’t Forgive, Remember, You Do It All the Time
content: As we gather to celebrate the holidays during a difficult year, we’d be wise to consider a posture of grace.

title: Twitter’s Jack Dorsey Steps Down From C.E.O. Role
content: The social media pioneer, whose name has become synonymous with the company, was replaced by Twitter’s chief technology officer, Parag Agrawal.

more_info.byline: By Kate Conger and Lauren Hirsch

title: Chris Cuomo Played Outsize Role in Ex-Gov. Cuomo’s Defense
content: Chris Cuomo, the CNN host, participated in strategy discussions and shared a tip on at least one woman who had accused his brother, Andrew Cuomo, of sexual harassment.

more_info.byline: By Nicholas Fandos, Michael Gold, Grace Ashford and Dana Rubinstein

title: Millennials Confront High Inflation for the First Time
content: Americans born after 1980 have been wrestling with sharp price increases for the first time since they’ve been old enough to notice.

more_info.byline: By Jeanna Smialek, Sara Chodosh and Ben Casselman

title: As China Speeds Up Nuclear Arms Race, the U.S. Wants to Talk
content: The Pentagon thinks Beijing may build 1,000 or more weapons by 2030. But it’s the new technologies that worry strategists.

title: Colton Underwood Comes Out and Comes Clean
content: The former “Bachelor” star announced he is gay on national TV in April. A new Netflix reality series seeks to share his journey and address the criticism.

title: Omicron, the Fed, Tony Kushner: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
content: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: What We Know About the Omicron Variant
content: The World Health Organization has declared that this version of the coronavirus poses a very high risk to public health. How did they come to that conclusion?

content: Whether helping people stay clean and safe, pursue their educational dreams or find the aid they need, volunteers make a difference.

title: Tony Kushner, Oracle of the Upper West Side
content: When Steven Spielberg asked Kushner, America’s most important living playwright, to take on ‘West Side Story,’ he thought, ‘He’s lost his mind.’ But he dared.

title: With $125 Million Gift, Met Museum Jump-Starts New Modern Wing
content: The donation from a trustee, Oscar L. Tang, and his wife, Agnes Hsu‐Tang, reinvigorates the long-delayed project and is the largest capital gift in the Met’s history.

title: Prosecutors Push Elizabeth Holmes of Theranos to Take Responsibility
content: Under cross-examination, the founder of the failed blood testing start-up defended herself but admitted that she had made mistakes.

title: El Chapo’s Wife Sentenced to 3 Years in Prison
content: Emma Coronel Aispuro pleaded guilty in June to helping her husband, Joaquin Guzmán Loera, smuggle drugs into the United States and escape from prison.

title: California’s Ban on High-Capacity Magazines Is Restored by Appeals Court
content: The overturning of a district judge’s decision may also lead to the reinstatement of a state ban on semiautomatic weapons.

title: Josephine Baker Becomes First Black Woman Inducted Into France’s Tomb of Heroes
content: President Emmanuel Macron hailed the American-born dancer and French resistance fighter as a symbol of unity in a time of sharp division.

title: Detectives Work to Trace How Live Rounds Got on ‘Rust’ Film Set
content: Investigators are trying to determine whether a supplier who was supposed to provide the movie with blanks and dummies may have sent live rounds.

title: Adolfo, Designer Who Dressed Nancy Reagan, Dies at 98
content: Adolfo, who began as a milliner and took inspiration from Chanel, was also a favorite of New York society women.

title: Investors Snap Up Metaverse Real Estate in a Virtual Land Boom
content: Transactions for properties in digital realms are jumping, guided by the same principle in the physical world: location, location, location.

title: Farm Housing Mennonite Boys Engaged in Human Trafficking, Lawsuit Says
content: In a federal lawsuit against the Eastern Pennsylvania Mennonite Church, two plaintiffs said they were deprived of food and restrained with zip ties at a forced-labor farm.

title: What Is Cardiac Angiosarcoma?
content: Virgil Abloh, the celebrated fashion designer, died at 41 after being diagnosed with the rare cancer. Here’s what we know about it.

title: A Heart-Healthy Way to Eat
content: Aim for an overall healthful dietary pattern, the American Heart Association advises, rather than focusing on “good” or “bad” foods.

title: Do You Have the Heart for Marijuana?
content: Research suggests that smoking marijuana carries many of the same cardiovascular health hazards as smoking tobacco.

title: Should I Take a Heart Drug? A Coronary Calcium Scan May Help You Decide.
content: Many doctors recommend the heart test to pinpoint which patients would benefit from treatment to reduce their cardiovascular risk.

title: The Loss of a Child Takes a Physical Toll on the Heart
content: Grieving parents were at high risk of a heart attack in the days following the death of a child, and an increased risk may persist for years.

title: ‘The Power of the Dog’ Review: Wild Hearts on a Closed Frontier
content: In Jane Campion’s staggering take on the western, her first movie in more than a decade, a cruel cowboy meets his surprising match.

title: At 80, Robert Wilson Holds On to a Singular Vision for the Stage
content: Slowed but not stopped by the pandemic, Wilson has had a busy fall that continues with his production of “Turandot” at the Paris Opera.

title: A Walk Down the Aisle Tainted by Illness
content: After reciting her first vows in sickness, one woman dreams of a second ceremony to recommit to her husband and her body in better health.

title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘Your Husband Will Probably Leave You Now’
content: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.

title: This Fire-Loving Fungus Eats Charcoal, if It Must
content: Some fungi sprout in fiery shades of orange and pink after wildfires, feasting on what was left behind by the burn.
